name: bladderwrack
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of brown seaweed (= a plant that grows in the sea or on land very close to the sea) with air pockets in its leaves: The fronds of bladderwrack swayed gently, just below the surface of the water. Bladderwrack is edible and some people claim that, once dried, it makes a tasty snack.
More examplesFewer examplesThe kids spent many a happy hour popping the air pockets in the bladder wrack.Bladderwrack has a high iodine content and was once one of the main sources for it.Bladderwrack is sometimes used in fertilizer.
